title: Radiografer
qualification:
• Valid and active medical license
  • Proficient in general radiology techniques, including X-ray, MRI, and ultrasound.
  • Patient management skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Radiography
description:
• Evaluating patients’ medical histories
  • Suggesting alternative medical imaging techniques, when necessary.
  • Informing patients about the medical imaging process.
  • Using devices such as computer tomography (CT) scanners and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) machines.
  • Performing or directing radiology staff to carry out image-guided, diagnostic procedures.
  • Interpreting the results from diagnostic imaging procedures to determine diagnoses.
  • Following medical protocols for resuscitation, bleeding, infection, or other emergency situations, when necessary

title: Nurse – ICU
qualification:
• Minimum D3
  • Have at least 3 years ICU experience
  • Have ICU certificate
  • Have ACLS certificate
description:
• Evaluate and monitor the patient’s progress.
  • Identify sudden or subtle changes in a patient’s medical condition.
  • Deliver regular updates to doctors, patients, and their family members.
  • Begin treatment and monitor doses.
  • Care for patient needs throughout their recovery in the ICU unit.
  • Complete all necessary paperwork before transferring a patient.
  • Maintain patient records.

title: Nurse – CSSD
qualification:
• Min. D3 in Nursing
  • Have CSSD experience in hospital
  • Have certificate about CSSD
description:
• Handle all equipment’s with care and cleaning through the standard instrument processing.
  • Clean, disinfect and pack the medical instruments for sterilization based on the instrument processing of the department.
  • Keeping the facility’s stock of sterile devices up to date by regular inventory of stocks.
  • Identification of surgical instrumentation by proper name and appropriate sterilization method.
  • Report immediately broken or malfunctioning equipment to charge nurse.
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment in compliance with healthcare procedures and regulations.
